tweets.text:
We've been planting trees around the Memorial Gardens in #York, to replace four trees we took out in 2019 to create space to build flood defences. For every tree we remove on the #YorkFAS we are planting five new trees. 
https://t.co/fjLkV5dh5t https://t.co/1QCwiAgj9B

It's great to see our LGBT+ Network feature as a case study in @stonewalluk's toolkit to help employers make policies more inclusive.

We're proud that our organisation is consistently in the Top 100 Stonewall Employers.

Find out more: https://t.co/uJKI127F7T 

#LGBTHM21 https://t.co/2GlOAH8N8G

urls.title: Environment Agency silent on removal of pollution goal from performance report
urls.description: The Environment Agency will not be drawn on why it has dropped a target to reduce the number of pollution incidents from a regular report on its performance against environmental objectives, despite requests for an explanation from ENDS.

tweets.text:
Me: So @EnvAgency, why have you taken pollution incidents and a target to reduce them out of your performance reports?
EA: We'll get back to you on that.
Me: *twiddles thumbs*
Me: Helloooo? Is anyone there?
EA:ü§ê
https://t.co/Tqd9MZUd24

urls.title: Climate crisis hitting 'worst case scenarios', warns Environment Agency
urls.description: Sir James Bevan says extreme flooding in UK indicates urgent need for change if humanity is to survive

tweets.text:
‚ÄúMuch higher sea levels will take out most of the world‚Äôs cities, displace millions & make much of the rest of our land surface uninhabitable or unusable‚Äù says @EnvAgency CEO...so it must be NO to building Sizewell C on already eroding @SuffolkAONB coast
https://t.co/umybm2ZhD0
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency This has massive implications in terms of transboundary pollution issues. @VSinkevicius @EU_Commission @EUEnvironment @EU_ENV @DarraghOBrienTD @noonan_malcolm

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Then what is the point of calling it the ENVIRONMENTAL agency? What is the point of the agency at all? This is disgraceful. Rivers should not be used as open sewers. Utterly disgusting. I‚Äôm appalled. ü§¨ü§¨ü§¨ü§¨ü§Æü§Æü§Æü§Æü§Æ

tweets.text: @Feargal_Sharkey @HugoSAS @EnvAgency Thank you for highlighting this. Incidents should be published. However, unfortunately the EA is both regulator & prosecutor for environmental pollution? As such, prosecution (publication) could suggest policy failure. Perhaps it's time to devolve departmental responsibility.

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency WHAT? So if the EA aren‚Äôt looking at environmental pollution, what is the point of them then? What are their targets? Looking good on social media? Their Twitter says ‚Äúit‚Äôs our job to look after your environment‚Äù. üò≥

entity.name: Nature
entity.description: Consistently stunning documentaries transport viewers to far-flung locations ranging from the torrid African plains to the chilly splendors of icy Antarctica. The show's primary focus is on animals and ecosystems around the world. A comic book based on the show, meant to be used an as educational tool for kids, was briefly distributed to museums and schools at no cost in the mid-2000s.

tweets.text: Had a great spring day out on the Mimram selecting trees to drop into the river to aid sediment sorting, fish cover and bed scour. Bees and scarlet elf caps, it's not all trout. @HMWTBadger @EnvAgency @WildTroutTrust https://t.co/DHGpvPNOau

The criticism directed at @EnvAgency after @RachSalv found that it is removing river pollution targets from performance reporting has been huge. You would think @JamesBevanEA would explain his thinking but he never engages so shouldn‚Äôt be surprised at calls for him to resign.
And river pollution.......... https://t.co/UybrVvKAtk
Areas identifiable for scaling up work, but Grade 1 and 2 agricultural land prices challenging for charities for buy in order to extend restoration work explains Sarah Johnson of @Lancswildlife

Good idea for logging pollution incidents at https://t.co/FhmazZgd2r
Awesome chance for those who care to log what they observe. 
Sadly, since the regulator @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA has decided to chuck out pollution reports, who will do anything?
@Feargal_Sharkey

Tankering sewage around is cheaper than sorting out the causes and the failed sewage system @thameswater  The @EnvAgency and @ofwat condone it so the customer and environment take the hit @sandralaville @GeorgeMonbiot @robertcourts  This was a delivery TO Eynsham Oxon today. https://t.co/VTX0ALbYf1

urls.title: Britain's rivers should be returned to their 'natural state' to help save the endangered eel, says WWF
urls.description: Barriers such as weirs in our rivers are blamed for the decline of freshwater fish

tweets.text: There will come a day when, one by one, we set about removing the dams and weirs which straightjacket our rivers. We must rewild our rivers. https://t.co/JzTj6ExvR2

Our impact on the environment is of growing concern to many people.  

When making decisions about funerals, people often have a number of priorities in mind.  If you know about greener funeral choices then it can help you to include these, if that is important to you.

#electric https://t.co/KiTJ9x32cm
